conclusion: Apply principles of friction and mechanics.
Frictional force between block and board is product of normal force and coefficient of friction.
Board remains stationary, frictional force exerted by ground on board equals frictional force exerted by ground on block.
Frictional force exerted by ground on board is \( F_1 = \mu_1 \cdot N \).
Frictional force exerted by ground on block is \( F_2 = \mu_2 \cdot m \cdot v \).
Since board remains stationary, \( F_1 = F_2 \).
Substitute values into equation: \( \mu_1 \cdot N = \mu_2 \cdot m \cdot v \).
Substitute \( N = M \cdot v \) into equation: \( \mu_1 \cdot M \cdot v = \mu_2 \cdot m \cdot v \).
Magnitude of frictional force exerted by ground on board is \( F_1 = \mu_1 \cdot M \).
Substitute \( M = M \) back into equation: \( F_1 = \mu_1 \cdot M \).
Since \( F_1 = F_2 \), magnitude of frictional force exerted by ground on board is \( F_2 = \mu_1 \cdot M \).
Magnitude of frictional force exerted by ground on long wooden board \( ab \) is \( \mu_1 \cdot M \).
